problem_text: Let G be a group with a normal (pro-) 2-subgroup N such that G/N is isomorphic to GLn(2), inducing its natural module on N/Φ(N), the Frattini factor-group of N. For n = 3 determine G such that N is as large as possible. (For n > 3 it can be proved that already the Frattini subgroup Φ(N) of N is trivial; for n = 2 there exists G such that N is the free pro-2-group generated by two elements). B. Baumann
